For an adventure movie, I would recommend "American Dreamz". This movie follows the story of Scott Hercman, an American industrialist who gradually becomes concerned for his Jewish workforce after witnessing their persecution by the Nazis.

I would highly recommend "The English Patient" to you. This movie, directed by David Lynch, is set during World War II in a small town in England. The main character, an elderly woman named Rose DeWitt Bukater, is the only survivor of a plane crash that occurred near her home.  Over the course of the film, we see throughRose's eyes as she experiences both physical and emotional pain as well as moments of peace and calm reflection as she attempts to piece together what happened on that fateful day when she was witness to not only a plane crash but also the subsequent death of a passenger in the plane.  As the film progresses, we learn more about Rose's past including her involvement with an older man who later passed away. We also learn more about Rose's current situation including her ongoing battle with both physical and emotional pain as well as her ongoing attempts to piece together what happened on that fateful day when she was witness to not only a plane crash but also the subsequent death of a passenger in the plane.

I would recommend "Cold Mountain" to you. It is a historical drama that takes place during the American Civil War. The movie tells the story of John Dunbar, a Lieutentant in the United States Army. He is assigned to a remote western Civil War outpost. Dunbar finds himself engaging with a neighboring Sioux settlement, causing him to question his own purpose.
The movie "Cold Mountain" stars Oliver Rabourdin as John Dunbar, Liam Neeson as Captain Thomas O'Hara, and Holly Valance as Ellen Scott.
I hope you find this recommendation helpful and informative.
